title: 7 Simple Ways to Fix Nintendo Switch Not Connecting to TV

steps.title: Dock the Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Dock the Nintendo Switch. When your dock is properly plugged in and the Switch is docked, you should see the charging status on the top-left corner of your Switch. [1] X Research source If your Switch still isn't turning on after substantial time in the dock, the problem may lie in your dock. If there's a different Switch dock available, use it to see if this fixes the problem.

steps.title: Charge the Switch
steps.content: Charge the Switch directly. You can use the AC adapter to charge the Switch without the dock. [2] X Research source Remove the Switch and unplug the USB-C connector from the dock. Leave the AC adapter plugged into the wall. Insert the USB-C connector directly into the bottom of the Switch. Your Switch should begin to charge. If the Switch turns on after charging, you'll need to order a replacement dock or try to connect without a dock .

steps.title: Hold down the "POWER" button.
steps.content: Hold down the "POWER" button. You'll need to do this for at least 3 seconds. This is the button at the top-left of the Switch. You'll see a small Power icon next to the Volume buttons. [3] X Research source

steps.title: On the Switch, select Power Options.
steps.content: On the Switch, select Power Options . This will be underneath Sleep Mode . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Restart.
steps.content: Select Restart . Your Switch will restart. If you don't see this menu, press and hold the POWER button for at least 12 seconds to force-shutdown your Switch. When the Switch has finished restarting, you can dock it again.

steps.title: Disconnect all cables.
steps.content: Disconnect all cables. You may be using an HDMI cable that is damaged or old. In this case, purchase a new HDMI cable or use one that works on another device.

steps.title: Undock your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Undock your Nintendo Switch. Make sure to remove your Switch from its dock while you reconnect all the cables.

steps.title: Plug one end of the new HDMI cable into the dock.
steps.content: Plug one end of the new HDMI cable into the dock. Use the port labeled HDMI Out .

steps.title: Plug in the AC adapter into a wall outlet.
steps.content: Plug in the AC adapter into a wall outlet. This is the block-shaped adapter.

steps.title: Plug the other end of the new HDMI in your display.
steps.content: Plug the other end of the new HDMI in your display. Use an available HDMI port on your display screen.

steps.title: Dock your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Dock your Nintendo Switch. Make sure it's docked correctly. [5] X Research source The Switch should display on your screen. If it doesn't, try to press the Power button located at the top-left of the console.

steps.title: Unplug the HDMI port from your display.
steps.content: Unplug the HDMI port from your display. In some cases, a new port could fix your issue.

steps.title: Connect your HDMI
steps.content: Connect your HDMI to a new port. If the display still doesn't cast your Switch, try the remaining available HDMI ports. [6] X Research source If you don't have success, repeat these steps with a new HDMI cable to ensure it isn't a cable issue.

steps.title: Disconnect all cables.
steps.content: Disconnect all cables. This includes the USB-C connector of the Switch's AC adapter, the AC adapter itself, and the HDMI cable. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Undock your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Undock your Nintendo Switch. Make sure to remove your Switch from its dock while you reconnect all the cables.

steps.title: Plug the USB-C connector into the dock.
steps.content: Plug the USB-C connector into the dock. Flip open the back of the dock and use the port labeled AC adapter .

steps.title: Plug one end of the HDMI into the dock.
steps.content: Plug one end of the HDMI into the dock. Use the port labeled HDMI Out . [8] X Research source

steps.title: Plug in the AC adapter into a wall outlet.
steps.content: Plug in the AC adapter into a wall outlet. This is the block-shaped adapter.

steps.title: Plug the other end of the HDMI in your display.
steps.content: Plug the other end of the HDMI in your display. Use an available HDMI port on your display screen.

steps.title: Dock your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Dock your Nintendo Switch. Make sure it's docked correctly. [9] X Research source The Switch should display on your screen. If it doesn't, try to press the Power button located at the top-left of the console. You should now be able to play your Switch on the TV .

steps.title: Undock your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Undock your Nintendo Switch. You'll need to use your Switch in handheld mode for this method. When you first set up your Switch , you might have missed this option.

steps.title: Unlock your Switch.
steps.content: Unlock your Switch. In most cases, you'll need to click any button three times.

steps.title: Select System Settings.
steps.content: Select System Settings . This is the cog icon located at the bottom of the screen. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Select TV Settings.
steps.content: Select TV Settings . You can find this on the left panel, underneath Controllers and Sensors . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Select RGB Range.
steps.content: Select RGB Range . Set this to Automatic if it isn't already.

steps.title: Select TV Resolution.
steps.content: Select TV Resolution . This is the first option. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Select Automatic.
steps.content: Select Automatic . If your Switch is already set to Automatic , try 480p , 720p , or 1080p .

steps.title: Dock your Switch.
steps.content: Dock your Switch. The picture should now be displayed on your screen. If it isn't, try another resolution setting. If you have gone through all the resolution options, return to the RGB Range settings and toggle between Full Range and Limited Range .

steps.title: Undock your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Undock your Nintendo Switch. You'll need to use your Switch in handheld mode for this method.

steps.title: Unlock your Switch.
steps.content: Unlock your Switch. In most cases, you'll need to click any button three times.

steps.title: Select System Settings.
steps.content: Select System Settings . This is the cog icon located at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Select TV Settings.
steps.content: Select TV Settings . You can find this on the left panel, underneath Controllers and Sensors .

steps.title: Select Match TV Power State.
steps.content: Select Match TV Power State . By default, this will be On . Clicking this will toggle it Off . This ensures that your Switch will stay on despite your display being off. [13] X Research source
